data.title: Chinese Archives - Ethnicity of Celebs
data.text:
Birth Name: Sirikit Kitiyakara

Place of Birth: Bangkok, Siam (present-day Thailand)

Date of Birth: 12 August 1932

Ethnicity: Thai, some Chinese

Sirikit is the queen consort of Bhumibol Adulyadej, King of Thailand. She is the daughter of Nakkhatra Mangkala, 2nd Prince of Chanthaburi and Bua Snidvongs.

Sirikit’s paternal grandfather was Kitiyakara Voralaksana, 1st Prince of Chanthaburi (the son of Chulalongkorn and Uam Bisalayaputra). Chulalongkorn was the son of Mongkut and Debsirindra. Uam was the daughter of Yim Bisalayaputra and Prang Sombatsiri.

Sirikit’s paternal grandmother was Princess Apsarasaman Devakula (the daughter of Devan Uthaivongse, Prince Devavongse Varoprakarn and Yai Sucharitakul). Devan was the son of Mongkut and Piam Sucharitakul. Yai was the daughter of Hong Sucharitakul and Tat Dhammasaroj-Indravimala.

Sirikit’s maternal grandparents were Sadan Snidvongs (the son of Prince Sai Snidvongs and Khian Sasisamit) and Bang Bunyathon (the daughter of Ruai Bunyathon and Wae Na Bangxang). Sai was the son of Nuam, Prince Wongsadhirajsnid and Yaem Na Bangxang. Wae was the daughter of That Na Bangxang.

Source: Genealogy of Sirikit – https://www.geni.com

Birth Name: Renato Tirso Antonio Coronado Corona

Date of Birth: October 15, 1948

Place of Birth: Santa Ana, Manila, Philippines

Date of Death: April 29, 2016

Place of Death: Pasig, Metro Manila, Philippines

Ethnicity: Filipino (Tagalog), some Chinese

Renato Corona was the 23rd Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines, from May 17, 2010 to May 29, 2012, when he became the first Filipino government official to be impeached. His father, Juan M. Corona, was a lawyer, from Tanauan, Batangas. His mother, Eugenia Ongcapin Coronado, was a native of Santa Cruz, Manila. He was married to Cristina Basa Roco.

Renato’s maternal grandparents were Juan P. Coronado and María R. Ongcapin. The surname “Ongcapin” is of Chinese origin.

Sources: Renato’s birth record – https://familysearch.org

Birth record of Renato’s mother – https://familysearch.org

Birth Name: Sara Zimmerman Duterte

Place of Birth: Davao City, Davao del Sur, Philippine

Date of Birth: May 31, 1978

Ethnicity: Filipino (including Cebuano and Waray), some German, likely some Chinese, possibly distant Portuguese

Sara Duterte is a Filipina politician. She served as mayor of Davao City from June 30, 2010 to June 30, 2013, and will serve again on June 30, 2016. Her father, Rodrigo Duterte, is the presumptive 16th President of the Philippines. Her mother, Elizabeth Abellana Zimmerman, is of German descent. Her brother is politician Paolo Duterte. She is married to Manases “Mans” Reyes Carpio.

Her father has said:

You know, my grandfather was Chinese. My father was Cebuano. When I was asked about my father, [I answered] Cebuano. Why? As I have said, we traced the pedigree or lineage to the father.

Rodrigo has also stated that his mother, Soledad, was of Maranao descent (also Filipino). However, according to Soledad’s birth record, her father was born in Cebu City, while her mother was born in Maasin, Southern Leyte, indicating that they had Cebuano and Waray ancestries, respectively.

Sara’s paternal grandparents were Vicente Gonzales Duterte, who was the Governor of the undivided Davao province (the son of Facundo Duterte y Buot, or Facundo Buot Duterte in Filipino, and of Zoila Gonzáles) and Soledad “Soleng” Gonzales Roa (the daughter of Eleno Roa and Fortunata Gonzáles). Facundo was the son of Isabelo Veloso Duterte, also known as Isabelo Duterte, and of Concepción Buot. Isabelo’s great-great-great-great-grandfather was believed to be Diogo (or Diego in Spanish) Veloso, a 17th century Portuguese explorer. However, it is not clear if this is accurate. Eleno was the 4th municipal president of Liloan, Leyte, from 1911 to 1912.

Sara’s maternal grandparents were ? Zimmerman and ? Abellana.

Source: Genealogy of Sara Duterte (focusing on her father’s side) – https://www.geni.com

Birth Name: Paolo Zimmerman Duterte

Place of Birth: Davao City, Davao del Sur, Philippine

Date of Birth: March 24, 1975

Ethnicity: Filipino (including Cebuano and Waray), some German, likely some Chinese, possibly distant Portuguese

Paolo Duterte is a Filipino politician. He has served as vice mayor of Davao City since June 30, 2013. His father, Rodrigo Duterte, is the presumptive 16th President of the Philippines. His mother, Elizabeth Abellana Zimmerman, is of German descent. His sister is politician Sara Duterte. He is married to January Tabar Navares.

His father has said:

You know, my grandfather was Chinese. My father was Cebuano. When I was asked about my father, [I answered] Cebuano. Why? As I have said, we traced the pedigree or lineage to the father.

Rodrigo has also stated that his mother, Soledad, was of Maranao descent (also Filipino). However, according to Soledad’s birth record, her father was born in Cebu City, while her mother was born in Maasin, Southern Leyte, indicating that they had Cebuano and Waray ancestries, respectively.

Paolo’s paternal grandparents were Vicente Gonzales Duterte, who was the Governor of the undivided Davao province (the son of Facundo Duterte y Buot, or Facundo Buot Duterte in Filipino, and of Zoila Gonzáles) and Soledad “Soleng” Gonzales Roa (the daughter of Eleno Roa and Fortunata Gonzáles). Facundo was the son of Isabelo Veloso Duterte, also known as Isabelo Duterte, and of Concepción Buot. Isabelo’s great-great-great-great-grandfather was believed to be Diogo (or Diego in Spanish) Veloso, a 17th century Portuguese explorer. However, it is not clear if this is accurate. Eleno was the 4th municipal president of Liloan, Leyte, from 1911 to 1912.

Paolo’s maternal grandparents were ? Zimmerman and ? Abellana.

Source: Genealogy of Paolo Duterte (focusing on his father’s side) – https://www.geni.com

Birth Name: Harry Lee Kuan Yew

Date of Birth: 16 September 1923

Place of Birth: Singapore

Date of Death: 23 March 2015

Place of Death: Singapore

Ethnicity: Chinese (Hakka and Peranakan)

Lee Kuan Yew was the first Prime Minister of Singapore, from 3 June 1959 to 28 November 1990. His father, Lee Chin Koon, was a Chinese Indonesian immigrant, from Semarang, Central Java. His mother, Chua Jim Neo, was Peranakan. He was married to Kwa Geok Choo. Their son, Lee Hsien Loong, has served as Prime Minister of Singapore since 2004.

Lee Kuan Yew’s patrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his 25th great-grandfather, Lee Huo De.

Lee Kuan Yew’s paternal grandparents were Lee Hoon Leong (the son of Lee Bok Boon and Seow Huan Neo) and Ko Liem Nio. Lee Bok Boon emigrated from Dabu County, Guangdong province, China, to Singapore in 1863, and was the son of Lee Libin.

Lee Kuan Yew’s maternal grandparents were Chua Kim Teng and Neo Ah Soon.

Source: Genealogy of Lee Kuan Yew – https://www.geni.com

Place of Birth: Singapore

Date of Birth: 10 February 1952

Ethnicity: Chinese (Hakka and Peranakan)

Lee Hsien Loong is a Singaporean politician. He is the current and third Prime Minister of Singapore, having served in the position since 12 August 2004. His father, Lee Kuan Yew, was the first Prime Minister of Singapore, from 3 June 1959 to 28 November 1990. His mother was Kwa Geok Choo. He is married to Ho Ching. He was previously married to Wong Ming Yang.

Lee Hsien Loong’s patrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his 26th great-grandfather, Lee Huo De.

Lee Hsien Loong’s paternal grandparents were Lee Chin Koon (the son of Lee Hoon Leong and Ko Liem Nio) and Chua Jim Neo (the daughter of Chua Kim Teng and Neo Ah Soon). Lee Chin Koon was a Chinese Indonesian immigrant, from Semarang, Central Java. Chua Jim Neo was Peranakan. Lee Hoon Leong was the son of Lee Bok Boon and Seow Huan Neo. Lee Bok Boon emigrated from Dabu County, Guangdong province, China, to Singapore in 1863.

Lee Hsien Loong’s maternal grandparents were Kwa Siew Tee (the son of Kwa Wan Tjioe and Tan Bit Nio) and Wee Yew Neo (the daughter of Wee Theam Seng). Kwa Siew Tee was a Chinese Indonesian immigrant, from Semarang, Central Java. Kwa Wan Tjioe was the son of Kwa Khay It and Tan Giok Nio. Wee Theam Seng was the son of Wee Kay Chiang and Goh Teck Neo.

Source: Genealogy of Lee Hsien Loong – https://www.geni.com

Photo by palinchak/Bigstock.com

Birth Name: Yusof bin Ishak

Date of Birth: 12 August 1910

Place of Birth: Terong, Taiping, Perak, Federated Malay States (now Malaysia)

Date of Death: 23 November 1970

Place of Death: Singapore

Ethnicity:

*Indonesian (Minangkabau), distant Arab and Chinese (father)

*Malay, Afghan (mother)

Yusof Ishak was a Singaporean politician. He was the first President of Singapore, serving from 9 August 1965 to 23 November 1970. His father, Encik Ishak bin Ahmad, was of Minangkabau descent. His mother, Aishahtun Aminuddin, was a Malay from the Langkat region in Indonesia. He was married to Puan Noor Aishah.

Yusof’s paternal grandparents were Ahmad bin Abdullah (the son of Abdullah bin Dato Jenaton and Umi Salamah, also known as Oomeye Selamah) and Siti Kechik Rokiah (the daughter of Abd Rahman Al-Baghdadi and Isteri Pertama). Yusof’s great-grandfather Abdullah was the son of Dato Jenaton “Jenan” bin Raja Labu and an unknown Chinese-Arab woman. Abd Rahman was the son of Abdul Qadir Al-Baghdadi.

Yusof’s maternal grandparents were Aminudin bin Nakhoda Sulong (the son of Nakhoda Sulong bin Mohamad Kaul and Uda Saka, also known as Zainab bint Orang Kaya) and Khatijah (the daughter of Mohd Tahir). Nakhoda Sulong was the son of Mohamad Kaul bin Raja Natan and Puti Kalimah. Mohd was of Afghan descent.

Source: Genealogy of Yusof Ishak – https://www.geni.com

Birth Name: Sharin Fosberg

Place of Birth: Emmelev, Djursland, Denmark

Date of Birth: November 11, 1973

Ethnicity:

*75% Danish

*25% Chinese

Sharin Foo is a Danish singer, songwriter, and musician. She is part of the indie rock duo The Raveonettes, in which she sings, as well as plays the guitar and bass.

Sharin’s father is musician Kim Tai Foo. She was previously married to musician Greg Edwards, with whom she has a daughter.

Sharin has stated:

I don’t look too Chinese. I have all the Scandinavian colors, but I’ve got the Chinese nose and the eyes. My grandfather came from a tiny little three-house village in China –— he came to Denmark and had all these girlfriends, and he liked it so much that he had to stay. He started the first Chinese restaurant in Copenhagen. My father is totally Danish, but he looks Chinese.

Photo by prphotos.com

Birth Name: China Eiko Chow

Place of Birth: Southwark, London, England

Date of Birth: April 15, 1974

Ethnicity:

*50% Chinese

*25% German

*25% Japanese

China Chow is a British actress and model. She is the daughter of Tina Chow (born Bettina Louise Lutz) and Michael Chow.

Her father is well known as the owner of the restaurant chain Mr Chow; he was born in Shanghai, China, to Zhou Xinfang, a famous actor, and Lilian Qiu, from a wealthy family.

China’s mother, a model, jewelry designer, and influential fashion icon, was born in Lakeview, Ohio, to a German-American father, Walter Edmund Lutz, and a Japanese mother, Mona Furuki. The couple met in Japan while Walter served in the American military. China’s mother, Tina, died of AIDS at the age of 41, as a result of an extramarital affair with French aristocrat Kim D’Estainvillle.

China has a brother, Max, who is three years younger. Her aunt is actress and former “Bond girl” Tsai Chin.

China’s maternal grandfather was Walter Edmund Lutz (the son of Ferdinand Carl Lutz and Lydia Anna Catherine Weseloh). Ferdinand was born in Ohio, the son of German parents, Carl Paul Edmund Lutz and Augusta L. Schultz. Lydia was born in Ohio, to a German-born father, The Rev. Heinrich/Henry Johann/John Weseloh, a Lutheran minister, and to a mother, Fannie Marie Rastede/Scheer, who was born in Illinois, to German parents.

Sources: Obituary of China’s mother – http://www.nytimes.com

Genealogy of China’s maternal grandfather, Walter Edmund Lutz (focusing on his mother’s side) – http://worldconnect.rootsweb.ancestry.com

China’s maternal grandfather, Walter Edmund Lutz, on the 1920 U.S. Census – https://familysearch.org

China’s maternal great-grandmother, Lydia Anna Catherine Weseloh, on the 1900 U.S. Census – https://familysearch.org

Birth Name: Sun Wen

Date of Birth: November 12, 1866

Place of Birth: Xiangshan County, Guangdong, China

Date of Death: March 12, 1925

Place of Death: Beijing, China

Ethnicity: Chinese (Cantonese and Hakka)

Sun Yat-sen was a Chinese revolutionary, and medical practitioner. He was Provisional President of the Republic of China, from 1 January, 1912 to 10 March, 1912, and Premier of the Kuomintang of China, from 10 October, 1919 to 12 March, 1925, his death.

He was the son of Sun Da-cheng and Yang ?. He was married to Lu Muzhen, Kaoru Otsuki, and Soong Ching-ling.

Sun Yat-sen’s patrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his 15th great-grandfather, Sun Hao, also known was Sun You-song.

Sun Yat-sen’s paternal grandfather was Sun Jing-xian (the son of Sun Heng-hui and Cheng ?) and Wong ?. Sun Heng-hui was the son of Sun Dian-zhao and Lin ?.

Sun Yat-sen’s maternal grandfather was Yang Teng-hui.

Birth Name: Jose Maria Canlas Sison

Place of Birth: Cabugao, Ilocos Sur, Philippines

Date of Birth: February 8, 1939

Ethnicity: Filipino (Ilocano, Kapampangan, and remote Pangasinan), some Chinese and Spanish

Jose Maria Sison is a Filipino writer and activist. He founded the Communist Party of the Philippines. His father, Salustiano Serrano Sison, was also a native of Cabugao, Ilocos Sur. His mother, Florentina Lopez Canlas, was a native of Manila. He is married to Julieta “Julie” Bagaporo de Lima, whose niece is lawyer Leila de Lima.

Jose Maria’s patrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his fourth great-grandfather, Domingo Sison, of Lingayen, Pangasinan. The surname “Sison” is of Chinese origin. He has said that the first Sison was one of the captains of a merchant vessel owned by Chinese pirate Limahong, who invaded the northern Philippine Islands in 1574. In the early 18th century, the first recorded Sison was listed as mestizo de sangley in Lingayen, Pangasinan.

Jose Maria’s paternal grandfather was Gorgonio “Gonyong” Sison Soller (or Gorgonio Soller Sison in Filipino, the son of Julián Sison Espíritu, or Julián Espíritu Sison in Filipino, and of Bonifacia Soller Sevilleja, or Bonifacia Sevilleja Soller in Filipino). Julián was the son of Atanacio Sison Teaño, or Atanacio Teaño Sison in Filipino, and of Petrona Espíritu. Bonifacia was the daughter of Braulio Soller and Germana Sevilleja.

Jose Maria’s paternal grandmother was Martiniana Serrano Azcueta (or Martiniana Azcueta Serrano in Filipino, the daughter of Leandro Serrano and Úrsula Azcueta Guerrero, or Úrsula Guerrero Azcueta in Filipino). Leandro was said to be a Spanish mestizo, and was the son of Modesto Soloza Solla, or Modesto Solla Soloza in Filipino, and of Dominga Serrano. Úrsula was the daughter of Patricio Azcueta Fariñas, or Patricio Fariñas Azcueta in Filipino, and of Valentina Guerrero.

Jose Maria’s maternal grandparents were Gervacio Canlas Muñoz (or Gervacio Muñoz Canlas in Filipino, the son of Hilario Canlas Lacsamana, or Hilario Lacsamana Canlas in Filipino, and of Alejandra Muñoz Aguas, or Alejandra Aguas Muñoz in Filipino) and Eusebia López García (or Eusebia García López in Filipino, the daughter of ? López and ? García). Hilario was the son of Agapito Canlas and Francisca Lacsamana. Alejandra was the daughter of Guillermo Muñoz and Engracia Aguas.

Sources: Ang Rebolusyong Pilipino: Isang Pagtanaw Mula sa Loob

Genealogy of Jose Maria Sison – https://www.geni.com

Birth Name: Balthazar Johannes Vorster

Date of Birth: December 13, 1915

Place of Birth: Uitenhage, Cape Province (now Eastern Cape), South Africa

Date of Death: September 10, 1983

Place of Death: Cape Town, South Africa

Ethnicity:

*89.74609375% Afrikaner (39.697265625% Dutch, 27.63671875% German, 18.310546875% French, 2.5390625% Belgian [1.5625% Flemish, 0.9765625% Walloon], 1.5625% Swiss-German)

*3.125% Danish

*1.953125% Indonesian

*1.85546875% Indian

*1.5625% Norwegian

*1.3671875% African (0.78125% Angolan, 0.5859375% Guinean)

*0.390625% Chinese

B. J. Vorster was a South African politician. He was the 8th Prime Minister of South Africa, from 13 September, 1966 to 2 October, 1978, and the 4th State President of South Africa, from October 10, 1978 to June 4, 1979. He was the son of Elizabeth Sophia (Wagenaar) and Willem Carel Vorster. He was married to Martini Steyn “Tini” Malan.

B. J.’s patrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his fourth great-grandfather, Hans (or Jan in Dutch) Vorster, of Bern, Switzerland.

A few of B. J.’s distant ancestors were slaves, from Africa (Angola and Guinea), China, India, and Indonesia.

Some research suggests that B. J. had Italian ancestry. It is not clear if this ancestry have been documented/verified.

B. J.’s paternal grandfather was Olof Abraham Vorster (the son of Johannes Hendrik Vorster and Sophia Aletta Jacoba de Meyer). Johannes was the son of Jacobus Adriaan Vorster and Martha Elisabeth Jacoba Lubbe. Sophia was the daughter of Olaf Abraham Servaas Meyer and Anna Christina Weydeman; Anna’s father, Pieter Andries Christiaan Weijdeman, was a Danish immigrant, from Copenhagen.

B. J.’s paternal grandmother was Anna Catharina Elizabeth van der Merwe (the daughter of Jacobus Daniël van der Merwe and Maria Johanna Elizabeth Davel). Jacobus was the son of Willem Karel van der Merwe and Margaretha Johanna de Wit. Margaretha’s paternal great-great-grandfather, Robbert Robberts Brand, was a Norwegian immigrant, from Christiania (now Oslo). Robbert’s mother was Johanna Susanna Ferreira, whose last name is of Portuguese origin, suggesting that she may have had Sephardi Jewish ancestry; it is unclear if that was the case. Maria Johanna was the daughter of Isak Johannes Davel and Anna Catharina Elisabeth Visagie.

B. J.’s maternal grandfather was Johannes Jacobus “Jan” Wagenaar (the son of Johannes Petrus Wagenaar and Catharina Christina Wilhelmina Oelofse). B. J.’s great-grandfather Johannes was the son of Johannes Jacobus Wagenaar and Jacoba Johanna Viviers. Catharina was the son of Nicolaas Jacobus Oelofse and Maria Elizabeth de Jager. Nicolaas’ paternal great-grandfather, Andries Oelofse, was a Norwegian immigrant, from Christiania (now Oslo).

B. J.’s maternal grandmother was Johanna Maria Elisabeth Wepener (the daughter of Frederik Jacobus Wepener and Maria Geertruyda Bekker). Frederik was the son of Frederik Jacobus Wepener and Johanna Maria Erasmus. B. J.’s great-grandmother Maria Geertruyda was the daughter of Stephanus “Petrus” Bekker and Maria Elisabeth Jansen van Rensburg.

B. J.’s matrilineal ancestry can be traced back to his ninth great-grandmother, Jean(ne) Francomme, of Calais, France.

Source: Genealogy of B. J. Vorster – https://www.geni.com
